Dear Sir,

How are you and the daily activities including your
family? Hope everybody is fine.

Though we've not met before, I Ben, I got your contract trought the
ACCRA chimber of comence, here in ACCRA- GHANA
I am a citizen of Sierra Leone, elder son to the
Minister of Mines and Energy who was killed during the
Sierra Leonean war by the rebels. My father died and
left behind physical cash of $12 Million USD which he
safely kept in a Security Finance Company during his
regime in the office.

I want to invest this money in any profitable business
of your choice in your country. I am hereby soliciting
your assistance to be my foreign partner because I've
not been to Europe/U.S. before in my life. So I don't
want to make any costly mistake that will make me lose
my money.

You will be entitled to 10% of the total sum for your
assistance. All I want is for you to receive the money
and send invitation letter for me to join you.

Your urgent reply will enable me to arrange with the
Security Finance Company to move this money through
their special Diplomatic Courier Services to your
country. For you to claim it till I will meet you up
in your country for my investment.

All the necessary documents of deposit from the
Security Company are with me.

In your reply, please include your private telephone
and fax numbers. And remember to call me as soon as
you send your reply so that I will pick it up.

Thanks for your co-operation.

My best regards

Ben   Fran

messages.body:
Dear Ben

I am greatly intrigued by your message. How did you get my address? I do not remember having much dealings with the ACCRA chamber of commerce, although admittedly I was once seconded by the UN Medical Corps to help out in your area a few year back when there was an outbreak of Lethargis Wankeritus. Perhaps you suffered from this yourself? It is very common.

I do not know what to say, as this is such a bolt from the blue. As you sure it was meant for me? I am a doctor with a busy practice here in the UK, very busy indeed, so much so in fact that many of my patients have to be dispatched early back home.

Any way, as I say I am interested to hear your thoughts.

HAROLD

messages.subject: F - Doc: is yr number working?/Doc - F - Try the British Medical Association
messages.body:
Dear Frank

I am surprised that you have difficulty reaching me on my number, although I was wondering how you managed to try at all, when yesterday you said you had no access to a phone? I have checked the number that I gave you and, my apologies it seems incorrect. I have tried your number and, alas no one there had heard of you - are you working under a different name? I know that sometimes refugees and escapees need new identities, if so please let me know.

Please call me soon on  44 (0) 20 7387 4499 and ask for myself or my associate Dr Crippen. He is very discreet and will be able to put you out of your misery just as quickly as I, rest assured of that.

Best regards

HAROLD
